state of the art performance.on: three of the four data sets

CNN + MCFA.from sentence: We show that CNN + MCFA achieves state of the art performance on three of the four data sets and performs competitively on one data set .

N = 1.from sentence: When N = 1 , MCFA increases the performance of a normal CNN from 85.0 to 87.6 , beating the current state of the art on the CR data set .

N = 10.from sentence: When N = 10 , MCFA additionally beats the state of the art on the TREC data set .

our ensemble classifier.from sentence: Finally , our ensemble classifier additionally outperforms all competing models on the MR data set .

all data sets.from sentence: On all data sets except SUBJ , the accuracy of CNN + B1 decreases from the base CNN accuracy , while the accuracy of our model always improves from the base CNN accuracy .

conclude that.from sentence:
We also compare two different kinds of additional context : topics ( TopCNN ) and translations ( CNN + B1 , CNN + B2 , CNN + MCFA ) .
Overall , we conclude that translations are better additional contexts than topics .

single context.from sentence: When using a single context ( i.e. TopCNN word , TopCNN sent , and our models when N = 1 ) , translations always outperform topics even when using the baseline methods .

topics.from sentence: Using topics as additional context also decreases the performance of the CNN classifier on most data sets , giving an adverse effect to the CNN classifier .
